segments.text: I see the woman standing in that puddle, and it’s almost funny how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is probably getting wet, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and I’m worried he’ll fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it could tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, completely trusting him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just flowing and flowing, and the floor is getting more slippery by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice and tidy, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will ever learn their lesson about sneaking cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so strange, like a moment frozen in time.
segments.speaker: PAR
